timeline.message:
Fix testIncorrectPasswordHashingAlgorithm

that the hasher selected for hashing in the beginning of the tests is
not the same that is set in passwordHashingSettings for the test to
make sense.

Resolve: #66824

timeline.bodyText: These still can be the same as the one returned by getFastHashingAlgorithmForTest. We need to use a randomFrom in both places with different contents
timeline.author: jkakavas

replies.bodyText: I take the comment back:) still leave this up to Yang but I think we should use two randomFrom either way to make sure this won't fail if we ever  change the implementation of getFastHashingAlgorithmForTest
replies.author: jkakavas

replies.bodyText: Or randomOtherThan ? (drive by comment, I haven't checked the underlying logic)
replies.author: tvernum
tvernum

timeline.message:
Fix testIncorrectPasswordHashingAlgorithm

Changing to use randomOtherThan instead

Resolve: #66824
